main event: Several sightings of unidentified objects, primarily identified as weather balloons, were reported over Nashville and Memphis, Tennessee between May and June 1961.
interesting points: The object was first reported as a dot increasing in size, suggesting it approached the observer., The Nashville Civil Defense called the sighting a 'routine weather balloon.', Local TV station employees confirmed the object as a weather balloon., Pilots from Navy jets reported observing a triangular-shaped object at 20,000 feet., The object had lights on the edge and made no sound, leading to speculation about its nature.
witness description: Local TV station employees, air traffic controllers, and Navy pilots.
